I20060215-0010

I found lots of these exceptions in my log. A new one is added each time I select something in the Debug view. Removing the launch from the Debug view stopped the logging.

	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:585)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:338)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:282)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:952)

When input is changed in the viewer, #unmapAllElements dispose the model node.
#nodeDisposed in turn dispose the TreeItem widget associated with the node.

#unmapAllElements is run with #preservingSelection.  After the elements are unmapped, the viewer tries to restore its selection.  In AsynchronousTreeModelViewer#doAttemptSelectionToWidget, the selection code is actually checks to see if the widget is disposed before it attempts to set selection.  

After that the viewer tries to map the elements to a widget again.  But the widget associated with the selection is already disposed.  Hence we get a widget disposed exception when trying to get all children under the parent widget.  Failed at #getItems(widget);
Fixed in AsynchronousTreeModelViewer.  Added #isDisposed check before trying to map an element to a widget.
Verified. As well, removed preserving selection when unmapping elements. There is no need to preserve selection when getting rid of everything in the view.
